revised_title: The Chemical Composition of Soap Films
tldr: The author investigates the composition of soap films and discovers that they contain acid sodium soap, not free oleic acid as previously thought. The accumulation of this soap in the surface is influenced by the nature of the soap solution, with the highest accumulation occurring in solutions with an excess of either oleic acid or alkali. The author also concludes that the structural basis of the black spots in soap films is an acid sodium soap.
